tag-1: Jamaica: Citi Celebrates Two Centuries of Excellence
tag-3: Kingston, Jamaica – This year Citi celebrates its global 200-year anniversary at the forefront of banking excellence. To commemorate the anniversary, on March 31, 2012, Citi Jamaica held a cocktail reception at its offices at 19 Hillcrest Avenue, Liguanea. The event, which was hosted by Citi Jamaica Country Officer Peter Moses, was attended by more than 400 government officials, clients and employees.
tag-4: The occasion also included the official opening of the bank's new location at Hillcrest Avenue by Hon. Dr. Peter Phillips, Minister of Finance and Planning. Minister Phillips, in his remarks, congratulated Citi on the occasion of its 200-year anniversary and also recognized the contribution of the local franchise to the development of the country.
tag-5: "Citi Jamaica began operations in 1960 and has had a long-standing commitment to the country by working to support economic growth and development and leveraging the bank's global network and experience to build a better future for our clients and the communities in which we operate," said Citi Country Officer Peter Moses.
tag-6: Citi was first established in 1812 as a trade finance bank, enabling commerce between New York and Liverpool. Since then, the company has grown to become a leading global financial services brand serving 200 million clients in more than 100 countries, 24 of which are in Latin America. Working at the center of global trade and capital flows, Citi has enabled some of the world's most transformative projects, including the Transatlantic Cable and the jumbo jet. With unrivalled presence in emerging markets, the company is well positioned to continue helping to fuel progress and economic growth.
tag-7: "Citi's 200-year anniversary represents a key milestone in Citi's history. For two centuries, our central mission has been to enable economic growth and development, supporting our clients and the communities where we operate. We are passionate about improving people's lives through financing innovation, from the Panama Canal to the Google Wallet," said Chief Administrative Officer Don Callahan.
tag-8: Citi Jamaica will be joined by other countries around the world in its celebration of the company's 200-year anniversary. During 2012, more than 20 events are planned in countries across Latin America, illustrating the company's extensive presence throughout the region, and its commitment to continued support of economic progress and innovation.
tag-9: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
